text: Jepsen performing in 2012 Canadian singer and songwriter Carly Rae Jepsen started her discography with her self-released EP Dear You following Tug of War, her debut album, which was released in September 2008, 4 years later. The album spawned two Canadian Hot 100 top 40 singles, "Tug of War" and "Bucket", both of which were accredited gold certifications by Music Canada (MC).Peak chart positions for singles in Canada: * For all except where noted: * For "Good Time": Her second album, Kiss, was released in September 2012. "Call Me Maybe", also the lead single from her 2012 EP Curiosity, attained international success, reaching number one in Canada, Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States, among others.Peak positions in the United Kingdom: * For all except where noted: * For "This Kiss": Peak chart positions for singles in the United States: * "Call Me Maybe": * "Good Time": Curiosity went on peak at number six on the Canadian Albums Chart. Its title track was released as its second single, peaking at number 18 in Canada. The same year, she collaborated with American artist Owl City on the single "Good Time". The song topped the charts in Canada and New Zealand and reached the top ten in several other countries, including Australia, Ireland, United Kingdom and the United States. Jepsen's third album, Emotion, was released in 2015 and is influenced by songs from the 1980s. Its lead single "I Really Like You", peaked at number 14 in Canada and attained top five and top 40 positions in the UK and US, respectively. The second single, "Run Away with Me", was released in July. Jepsen has had nine singles chart within the Top 50 of the Canadian Hot 100, two of which reached number one. After the success of Emotion, she released a remix album based on the album, entitled Emotion Remixed +, and a compilation of 8 tracks that didn't make it onto her third studio album, entitled Emotion: Side B. ==Released songs== {| id="toc" class="toc" summary="Class" ! |- | style="text- align:center;"|ABCDEFGHILMNPQRSTUWY |} {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="font-size:90%;" |+Key |style="background- color:#D8BFD8"| |Indicates single release |- |style="background- color:#ffff00"| |Indicates promotional single release |- |style="background- color:#ced343"| |Indicates song included on an alternative version of the album |- |} {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align: center;" ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Artist(s) ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| Writer(s) ! scope="col" | Album ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | |- ! scope = "row" | "All I Need Is an Angel" | Carly Rae Jepsen | Tom Kitt Brian Yorkey | Grease: Live | 2016 | |- ! scope="row" style="background- color:#ffff00" | "All That" | Carly Rae Jepsen | Carly Rae Jepsen Ariel Rechtshaid Devonté Hynes | E•MO•TION | 2015 | |- ! scope="row" style="background- color:#ffff00" | "Almost Said It" | Carly Rae Jepsen | Carly Rae Jepsen | style="background-color:#ced343"|Kiss ‡ | 2012 | |- ! scope = "row" | "Automatically in Love" | Carly Rae Jepsen | Carly Rae Jepsen John Hill Rogét Chahayed Nate Campany | Dedicated | 2019 | |- ! scope="row" | "Backseat" | Charli XCX featuring Carly Rae Jepsen | Charlotte Aitchison Alexander Guy Cook Finn "EasyFun" Keane Carly Rae Jepsen | Pop 2 | 2017 | |- ! scope = "row" | "Beautiful" | Carly Rae Jepsen featuring Justin Bieber | Toby Gad Justin Bieber Alex Lambert | Kiss | 2012 | |- ! scope="row" | "Better Than Me" | Blood Orange featuring Carly Rae Jepsen | Devonté Hynes | Freetown Sound | 2016 | |- ! scope="row" | "Black Heart" | Carly Rae Jepsen | Carly Rae Jepsen Greg Wells E.
